title: 820-00239 Flashing Folder
message:
Liquid Damage

Had a main line short wouldnt boot. Removed short and it boots.
Flashing Folder
Checked U9300 found a short on PP1v8_SSD_Cold
Replaced U9300 short gone
I get 0v on L9340 and L9330
PP3v3_S5_SSD is 3.311v
Storage_LB_EN is 3.3v
Storage_EN is 3.3v
SSD_PWR_EN_L is 0v (when a line says EN L does that mean it goes low for reset or stays low?) I feel this is my issue
SSD_Boot_L 1.8v
SSD_PCIE_CLKREQ_L is 3.3v

Trying to find the root of where its all turned on. Seems that comes from CPU and Im missing but Im not sure if that circuit has a prior trigger or source that tells CPU to enable SSD.

title: 820-00239 Flashing Folder
message:
Check J9600 for corrosion; clean it and try again.

"SSD_PWR_EN_L is 0"
Correct, as is active low; what "_L" means...

"SSD_PCIE_CLKREQ_L is 3.3v"
For same reason, this should be 0V; or PCH will not provide clock to SSD.

But you still miss 1V8 and 1V2 for SSD.
Check if SSD_RESET_L is high.

title: 820-00239 Flashing Folder
message: SSD_RESET_L is 0v but if I disconnect the Life Boat Connector the voltage on the feed side is only 0.6v

title: 820-00239 Flashing Folder
message:
You must check all voltages with SSD/Lifeboat connected.
Also check diode mode to ground in both cases.
Be sure no corrosion there and good solders.

title: 820-00239 Flashing Folder
message: J9600 was clean. No corrosion on that connector. Ill check both sides.

title: 820-00239 Flashing Folder
message:
Did you pick U9300 from same donor board?
It may have firmware...

title: 820-00239 Flashing Folder
message: U9300 was a new chip from RossmannRepair. Dont have a donor board for this model currently. Diode readings will be a guess if they are ok or not. Obvious OL or 0 will be questionable

title: 820-00239 Flashing Folder
message: Customer doesnt want to wait so I guess Ill have to give up here on it. Sucks because its so close to working.
